Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description:
The Voidling Elemental can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain.

It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

The Voidling Elemental can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain.

Multiattack.name: å¤šé‡æ”»å‡»
Multiattack.description: The Voidling Elemental makes two attacks with Void Spark.

Void Spark.name: Void Spark
Void Spark.description: Void Spark. Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

Human Wizard CR5.name: Human Wizard CR5
Human Wizard CR5.description:
The Architect Quotes

Unstable

General Lines (Influenced by Any Aspect):

  1. "This... this isnâ€™t right! Pieces... missing... too many cracks to hold together!"

  2. "I feel them! Pulling at me... too loud, too loud!" "Why did you do this? Why didnâ€™t you listen? Itâ€™s brokenâ€”itâ€™s all broken!"

Specific Influences:

  1. Scholar Influence: "Logic... fractured. Knowledge slipping through my hands! Why didnâ€™t you fix it properly?"

  2. Visionary Influence: "You held me back! Too timid, too blind to what must be done! I could have achieved perfection!"

  3. Dreamer Influence: "Dreams... haunting me. Memories of what could have been. You should have let it go!"

  4. Curious Influence: "I canâ€™t stop asking... what else? What could have been? Too many questionsâ€”no answers!"

  5. Coward Influence: "Fear... drowning me. Why didnâ€™t you stop it? Why did you let this happen?"

Stable

  1. "Youâ€™ve restored me... Thank you for pulling me from the abyss."

  2. "What youâ€™ve done here... it cannot have been easy. For that, you have my respect."

  3. "Youâ€™ve given me the chance to move forward, and for that, I am in your debt."

Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
Lightning Bolt.description:
A stroke of lightning forming a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 8d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The lightning ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

materials.value: A bit of fur and a rod of amber, crystal, or glass

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective magical force surrounds it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

Ray of Frost.name: Ray of Frost
Ray of Frost.description:
A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 1d8 cold damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Ray of Frost.name: Ray of Frost
Ray of Frost.description: Speed is reduced by 10ft until the start of your next turn.

Magic Missile.name: Magic Missile
Magic Missile.description:
You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

Higher Levels.Â When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the spell creates one more dart for each slot level above 1st.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

Mirror Image.name: Mirror Image
Mirror Image.description:
Three illusory duplicates of yourself appear in your space. Until the spell ends, the duplicates move with you and mimic your actions, shifting position so it's impossible to track which image is real. You can use your action to dismiss the illusory duplicates.

Each time a creature targets you with an attack during the spell's duration, roll a [[/r 1d20 # Mirror Image Check]] to determine whether the attack instead targets one of your duplicates.

If you have three duplicates, you must roll a 6 or higher to change the attack's target to a duplicate. With two duplicates, you must roll an 8 or higher. With one duplicate, you must roll an 11 or higher.

A duplicate's AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier. If an attack hits a duplicate, the duplicate is destroyed. A duplicate can be destroyed only by an attack that hits it. It ignores all other damage and effects. The spell ends when all three duplicates are destroyed.

A creature is unaffected by this spell if it can't see, if it relies on senses other than sight, such as blindsight, or if it can perceive illusions as false, as with truesight.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description:
You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.

Higher Levels.Â When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

Greater Invisibility.name: Greater Invisibility
Greater Invisibility.description: You or a creature you touch becomes Invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is Invisible as long as it is on the target's person.

Greater Invisibility.name: Greater Invisibility
Greater Invisibility.description: The target becomes Invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is Invisible as long as it is on the target's person.

Void Channeling.name: Void Channeling
Void Channeling.description: After the wizard casts a spell, up to two Voidling Elementals are summoned in unoccupied spaces within 10ft of him.

Stable Form.name: Stable Form
Stable Form.description: When the wizard loses all temporary HP, it will transform into its stable form.

Necrotic Pulse.name: Necrotic Pulse
Necrotic Pulse.description:
The Coward emits a wave of necrotic magic. All creatures in a 15ft radius must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. A target takes 1d10 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Note: Use this only if the Coward is left outside of the experiment.

Euphoric Embrace.name: Euphoric Embrace
Euphoric Embrace.description:
The Dreamer emits a wave of euphoria. Creatures within 15ft must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom save or be charmed for 1 minute. Charmed creatures see the nearest creature as a threat and attack it on their turn. They can repeat the save at the end of their turns to end the effect.

Note: Use this only if the Dreamer is left outside of the experiment.

Mental Assault.name: Mental Assault
Mental Assault.description:
The Scholar targets up to two creatures within range that it can see. Each target must succeed on a DC 14 Intelligence saving throw or be silenced for 1 minute. A silenced creature cannot speak, cast spells with verbal components, or communicate telepathically.

At the end of each of its turns, a silenced creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Note: Use this only if the Scholar is left outside of the experiment.

Motes of Force.name: Motes of Force
Motes of Force.description:
The Visionary conjures motes of force energy, targeting up to five different creatures he can see within range. Each mote hits its target automatically, dealing 2d4 + 2 force damage.

Note: Use this only if the Visionary is left outside of the experiment.

Sensory Lock.name: Sensory Lock
Sensory Lock.description:
The Curious can target one creature he can see within 30ft. The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is paralyzed. The creature can repeat the save at the end of his turn to end the effect.

Note: Use this only if the Curious is left outside of the experiment.

Stormforger.name: Stormforger
Stormforger.description:
Weapon (quarterstaff), legendary (requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, druid or wizard)

â€œBehold the power of the great storm!" the wizard shouted as the orb atop the staff began to swirl. "Feel its wrath and fear its might!" The winds howled, and bolts of lightning erupted from the staff, striking the ground and sending shock waves through the air.â€

The Stormforger staff is carved from a single piece of lightning-struck wood. The staff has a glowing orb made of pure crystal at the top which pulsates with energy and contains miniature tempests within.

This staff is not meant for melee attacks but while you hold it, you gain a +2 bonus to ranged spell attack rolls and it has 10 charges. It regains 1d4 + 2 expended charges after a long rest. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 20, the staff regains 2d4 + 2 charges.

While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend its charges unleashing the following abilities using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability modifier:

Tornado Takedown. Expending 2 charges allows you to summon a tornado that travels to a creature within 60ft. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save it takes [[/r 1d6]] bludgeoning damage and [[/r 2d6]] lightning damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.TpkZgLfxCmSndmpb]{Incapacitated} until the end of your next turn. On a successful save it takes half as much damage and is not @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.TpkZgLfxCmSndmpb]{Incapacitated}.

Aerial Ascension. Expending 5 charges you can harness the power of the tempest and summon a whirlwind beneath your feet, allowing flight for 10 minutes. The maximum altitude that can be reached while flying is 30ft.

Aerial Descent. If you are airborne after using Aerial Ascension, you can use your action to safely descend to the ground. This action does not consume any charges.

Thunderstorm of Misery. Expending 9 charges you can summoning a powerful storm around you in a 50ft radius for 1 minute. The storm creates dangerous terrain, making the ground slippery and filled with debris, making it difficult for creatures within the area of effect to move around. The winds, lightning strikes and heavy rain make it hard for creatures to see or hear, imposing disadvantage on any perception checks made while within the storm. The storm also unleashes bolts of lightning, forcing creatures within the affected area, to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save they take [[/r 8d6]] lightning damage, or half as much on a successful one.

Stormforger.name: Stormforger
Stormforger.description: +2 bonus to ranged spell attack rolls.

Eldritch Armor.name: Eldritch Armor
Eldritch Armor.description: Your base AC becomes 13 + your Dexterity modifier, as long as you aren't wearing armor.

Eldritch Armor.name: Eldritch Armor
Eldritch Armor.description: Your base AC becomes 13 + your Dexterity modifier, as long as you aren't wearing armor.

Eldritch Blast.name: Eldritch Blast
Eldritch Blast.description:
You hurl a beam of crackling energy. Make a ranged spell attack against one creature or object in range. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Force damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The spell creates two beams at level 5, three beams at level 11, and four beams at level 17. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

[[(floor((@details.level+1)/6)+1)]]{Total Beams}

Thaumaturgy.name: å¥‡æœ¯
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Arms of the Void.name: Arms of the Void
Arms of the Void.description:
You summon tendrils, which burst out violently around you. Each creature in a 10 ft. Emanation must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d6 necrotic damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and is not knocked prone.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 1.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level aboveÂ 2.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Frostguard.name: Frostguard
Frostguard.description:
A protective barrier of frost surrounds you. You gain 5 temporary hit points for the duration. While you have these temporary hit points, whenever a creature hits you with a melee attack, the attacker suffers 2 cold damage and its speed is reduced by 10 ft. until the start of its next turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Temporary Hit Points and the Cold damage both increase by 5 for each spell slot level above 1.

Frost Damage.name: Frost Damage
Frost Damage.condition: when a creature hits you with a melee attack

Frostguard Retaliation.name: Frostguard Retaliation
Frostguard Retaliation.description: Applies cold damage and speed reduction to melee attackers only while temp HP are present.

Agonizing Blast.name: Agonizing Blast
Agonizing Blast.description:
Add Charisma modifier to Eldritch Blast damage.

Note: This ability is hardcoded into the Eldritch Blast cantrip.

Mirror Image.name: Mirror Image
Mirror Image.description:
Three illusory duplicates of yourself appear in your space. Until the spell ends, the duplicates move with you and mimic your actions, shifting position so it's impossible to track which image is real.

Each time a creature hits you with an attack roll during the spell's duration, roll a [[/r d6]]for feach of your remaining duplicates. If any of the d6s rolls a 3 or higher, one of the duplicates is hit instead of you, and the duplicate is destroyed. The duplicates otherwise ignore all other damage and effects. The spell ends when all three duplicates are destroyed.

A creature is unaffected by this spell if it has the &Reference[blinded apply=false] condition, &Reference[blindsight], or &Reference[truesight].

Note: This spell creates three Active Effects. Deleting a duplicate's effect will also remove its corresponding animation.

Mirror Image Duplicate 1.name: Mirror Image Duplicate 1
Mirror Image Duplicate 1.description: Remove this effect to delete it's corresponding animation.

Mirror Image Duplicate 2.name: Mirror Image Duplicate 2
Mirror Image Duplicate 2.description: Remove this effect to delete it's corresponding animation.

Mirror Image Duplicate 3.name: Mirror Image Duplicate 3
Mirror Image Duplicate 3.description: Remove this effect to delete it's corresponding animation.

Zal'murak CR5.name: Zal'murak CR5
Zal'murak CR5.description:
It is not a god. It is the memory of what was left outside creation.

â€” Quarith Isen, Linebound Chronicler

Axarum, the Cycle Beyond Light

Axarum is not a god, not a realm and is not malevolent. It does not hunt. It simply is, and as it is, less of everything else becomes real. It is a cosmic force, a pulse in the firmament that spirals back into reality across vast stretches of time. No one knows whether it was caused, created, or simply always was. But when it draws near, the rules of existence bend, and the world forget it ever existed.

Axarum projects fragments, avatars of itself, birthed from the curvature of light, time, and memory.

Zalâ€™murak, the First Avatar

Where it walks, names die, and voices fracture.

Zalâ€™murak is the first, the scout, the ripple before the collapse. He appears humanoid only because minds require shapes to survive. Though terrible by mortal standards, it is only the edge of Axarumâ€™s return. It is drawn downward when the worldâ€™s invisible anchor tugs at the anomalyâ€™s orbit. Zalâ€™murak is feared, but it is not the end. It is the herald.

Hover.name: Hover
Hover.description: [[lookup @name ]] floats above the ground. It can move across any surface without making contact and cannot fall, even if it is knocked prone.

Rift Synchronization.name: Rift Synchronization
Rift Synchronization.description: When [[lookup @name]] is bloodied (reduced to half its hit points or fewer), it can make one Rift Claw attack against each enemy within range on its turn.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: [[lookup @name ]] has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Rift Claw.name: Rift Claw
Rift Claw.description:
+6 to hit, reach 60 ft., one target.
Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage.

[[lookup @name]] creates a rift in space between itself and the target and makes a melee weapon attack with advantage.

Nullfield.name: Nullfield
Nullfield.description: As a bonus action, [[lookup @name]] emits a gravitational anomaly in a 15 ft. radius that lasts for 1 minute or until [[lookup @name]] dies. While the field is active, creatures within the area cannot speak or cast spells with verbal components. Additionally, when a creature starts its turn in the field, it is affected by time distortion until the end of its turn. A creature affected in this way, has its speed halved, can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, and cannot take reactions.

Void Blink.name: Void Blink
Void Blink.description: [[lookup @name ]] distorts space and momentarily vanishes, reappearing in an unoccupied space it can see within 60 ft.

Singularity.name: Singularity
Singularity.description: (Recharge 5-6). Creatures within 20 ft. must make a [[/save con 15]] saving throw or take 27 (6d8) force damage, or half on a success. Creatures that fail the saving throw are also blinded for 1 minute and pulled 10 ft. toward [[lookup @name]] (they can repeat the save at the end of each of their turns, ending the blinded effect on a success).

Shortsword.name: çŸ­å‰‘
Shortsword.description: A medium sized blade with a firm crossguard and a leather-wrapped handle. A versatile weapon which makes up in versatility what it lacks in reach.

Ogre Whipmaster Grak CR2.name: Ogre Whipmaster Grak CR2
Ogre Whipmaster Grak CR2.description:
Grak Quotes

  1. "Grak not care about plans. Glurg care about breaking things!"

  2. "You have no chance against ogre strength. Give up before me smash you!"

  3. "Me no like quiet. Quiet means trouble. Ogres loud!"

  4. "Smash first, ask questions never!"

  5. "Me hungry! You look like good meal!"

  6. "Me see you sneaky. You try trick ogre, ogre get mad!"

Hide Armor.name: å…½çš®ç”²
Hide Armor.description: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

Ogre Brutality.name: Ogre Brutality
Ogre Brutality.description: Ogre Brutality. A melee attack deals one extra die of its damage when the ogre hits with it.

Punch.name: Punch
Punch.description: Punch. Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On a hit, the target takes [[/roll 1d4 + 4]] bludgeoning damage.

Throw Rock.name: Throw Rock
Throw Rock.description: Throw Rock. Ranged Attack: +6 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. On a hit, the target takes [[/roll 1d6 + 4]] bludgeoning damage.

Bladed Whip.name: Bladed Whip
Bladed Whip.description:
Weapon (whip), uncommon (requires attunement)

"This whip is golden! Each scar is priceless."

The whipâ€™s handle is wrapped in leather with shining metallic ends. At the tip of the whip is a blade made from the same glowing metal.

Whip Trip. When you hit a creature with this whip, you can attempt to trip it. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw DC 13 or fall prone.

Eviscerating Strike. When you score a critical hit with this whip, you deal an additional [[/roll 1d4]] slashing damage.

Shur-Axar CR15.name: Shur-Axar CR15
Shur-Axar CR15.description:
Recovered Inscription

â€œIt appeared above the plaza, unannounced, slowly descending. A perfect form with no intention. The High Oracles called it the Silent God. The learned ones named it the Shur-Axar (The Pale Avatar). The people watched, prayed, and panicked.

Days passed. No voice, no flame, no judgment. And yet, we began to unravel. Words lost their weight. Fathers no longer knew their daughters. Guilds forgot their purpose. Even the stars in our charts shifted, or vanished entirely.

A war followed, not with the being, but with each other. Faith against fear. Doctrine against memory. We fought to define it, and in doing so, lost ourselves more completely.

When the last conclave of mages attempted to strike it, out of desperation or clarity, it responded. Not in anger, but in correction.

Now there is nothing, and the names of our cities scatter like ash. I write only what I can still remember: it did not want. It did not ask. It only was.

And so, we are no longer.â€

Shur-Axar, the Second Avatar

Shur-Axar is the second known manifestation of Axarum, a cosmic force that exists beyond time, and memory. It is not a being in the traditional sense, but a projectionâ€”an imprint of Axarumâ€™s presence into reality. Whereas the first avatar, Zalâ€™murak, is a herald that weakens identity and distorts memory, Shur-Axar is the deeper convergence: a point of collapse where reality forgets how to hold shape.

Shur-Axar has no desires and no intention. It does not act until provoked. But its very presence unravels memories decay in its vicinity. Some believe it is not a being, but the echo of a truth too vast to name.

Shur-Axarâ€™s appearances are often catastrophic. It is drawn to regions of high cognitive densityâ€”places where life, knowledge, or magical resonance accumulate. While it can be forced to retreat, its connection to Axarum ensures it will eventually returnâ€”unless the orbit itself is severed.

Some cults revere it as a divine correction. Others view it as a cosmic anomaly to be studied, contained, or destroyed. But none who have confronted it speak with certainty. In most cases, they simply no longer speak at all.

Memory Erosion Field.name: Memory Erosion Field
Memory Erosion Field.description:
Creatures within 2 miles (2 km) of [[lookup @name]] location must succeed on a [[/save int 11]] saving throw at dawn or lose one minor memory (such as a name, location, or personal event). For every additional day [[lookup @name]] remains, the DC increases by 1 and the radius expands by 2 mile (2 km) (up to a maximum of DC 15 and 10 miles (10 km)).

A creature that fails this save three times forgets a major part of its identity (such as its purpose, family, or class features) until cured by greater restoration or wish. Memories lost this way cannot be recovered by lesser restoration or remove curse.

Magical means of detecting or recording information (such as sending, divination, or scribe spells) within the field suffer a 50% chance of failure or deliver incomplete results.

Cycle of Return.name: Cycle of Return
Cycle of Return.description:
[[lookup @name]] cannot be permanently destroyed. If reduced to 0 hit points, its body dissipates, leaving no corpse behind.

After 88 days, [[lookup @name]] re-manifests at a location of abundant life or strong magical resonance within the same plane. The new manifestation retains no memory of the previous encounter but resumes its existence as if uninterrupted.

Only a wish spell followed by a gate spell cast in unison during its moment of dispersal can sever its connection to the cosmic cycle and prevent its return.

Folded Perception.name: Folded Perception
Folded Perception.description: Folded Perception. [[lookup @name]] sees through darkness, invisibility, illusions, and magical concealment within 60 ft. It cannot be blinded.

Hovering Form.name: Hovering Form
Hovering Form.description: Hovering Form. [[lookup @name]] is unaffected by gravity, can hover even while unconscious, and moves over any terrain or surface without making contact.

Oblivion Response.name: Oblivion Response
Oblivion Response.description:
[[lookup @name]] does not initiate violence and ignores creatures unless directly harmed or subjected to hostile magic or abilities. If attacked or targeted by a harmful effect, it marks the aggressor as a threat and will retaliate with full force until the target is destroyed, rendered unconscious, or otherwise removed.

While pursuing a marked threat, [[lookup @name]] disregards collateral damageâ€”any creature, structure, or obstacle in its path may be affected by its abilities without hesitation or distinction.

Singularity Projection.name: Singularity Projection
Singularity Projection.description: [[lookup @name]] can make up to three Singularity Beam attacks as part of a single action.

Memory Refraction.name: Memory Refraction
Memory Refraction.description:
[[lookup @name]] targets up to two creatures it can see within 60 ft. Each target must succeed on a [[/save wis 19]] saving throw or become confused about their allies for 1 minute. While affected, a creature treats its own allies as enemies and prioritizes them when choosing targets for attacks, spells, or abilities.

[[lookup @name]] must maintain concentration on this effect (as if concentrating on a spell).

An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. A creature that succeeds on its initial save is immune to this ability for 24 hours.

Memory Refraction.name: Memory Refraction
Memory Refraction.description: While affected, a creature treats its own allies as enemies and prioritizes them when choosing targets for attacks, spells, or abilities.

Mindfracture Aura.name: Mindfracture Aura
Mindfracture Aura.description:
As a bonus action, [[lookup @name]] emits a mindfracture aura in a 30 ft radius that lasts for 1 minute or until [[lookup @name]] is reduced to 0 hit points. While the field is active, any creature that starts its turn within the area must succeed on a [[/save wis 18]] saving throw or become disoriented until the start of its next turn. While disoriented, the creature subtracts 1d4 from all attack rolls and saving throws.

This ability only works after the Aura Active Effect is applied to [[lookup @name]]

Aura.name: Aura
Aura.description: This AE activates the animation for Mindfracture Aura.

Disoriented.name: Disoriented
Disoriented.description: This creature is disoriented by Mindfracture Aura and has a 1d4 penalty to attack rolls and saving throws.

Singularity Beam.name: Singularity Beam
Singularity Beam.description: +11 to hit, range 90 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (5d8) force damage + 11 (2d10) radiant damage.

Lightscatter Beam.name: Lightscatter Beam
Lightscatter Beam.description: +11 to hit, range 90 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (5d8) force damage + 11 (2d10) radiant damage. On a hit, the target must also succeed on a [[/save int 18]] saving throw or forget one known language (chosen at random) for 1 hour.

Language Amnesia.name: Language Amnesia
Language Amnesia.description: You've forgotten one random known language for 1 hour.

Fracture Step.name: Fracture Step
Fracture Step.description:
[[lookup @name]] teleports up to 60 ft. to an unoccupied space it can see, leaving behind a gravitational ripple in a 15 ft. radius. The area becomes difficult terrain until the start of its next turn.

This ability only works after the Fracture Step Active Effect is applied to [[lookup @name]]

Fracture Step.name: Fracture Step
Fracture Step.description: Gravitational ripple from Fracture Step. The area is considered difficult terrain.

Axaric Radiance.name: Axaric Radiance
Axaric Radiance.description:
Lines of light emanate outward from [[lookup @name]] in a 15 ft. radius. Each creature in the area must make a [[/save con 19]] saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 17 (3d10) radiant damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and is not blinded.

This light bypasses magical and nonmagical darkness.

Power Beam.name: Power Beam
Power Beam.description: Power Beam. As an action, the Shard of Power emits a beam of energy that connects it to a creature. While the Shard remains active, the creature gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls and deals an additional 1d6 damage on each hit.

Volcathar the Flameborn CR10.name: Volcathar the Flameborn CR10
Volcathar the Flameborn CR10.description:
Volcathar the Flameborn Quotes

During the Ritual Encounter:

  1. "Remember this moment of desperation as you face me again. The flames of our next encounter will be far more intense!"

  2. "Whatâ€™s the matter? Are you afraid of a little heat?"

  3. "Iâ€™m here to make sure you roast slowly before the real battle begins!"

In the Lair:

  1. â€œWelcome to the inferno! I trust you find my domainâ€¦ welcoming?â€
  2. â€œThe lava beneath your feet will be your grave.â€
  3. â€œYou will know the true meaning of suffering before I end your pitiful existence!â€
  4. â€œAh, the sweet aroma of burning flesh. It is a scent I intend to enjoy thoroughly.â€

When Minions are Defeated:

  1. â€œThese weaklings thought they could bring glory to my name. They die as they livedâ€”worthless!â€

When Severely Injurend or on the Defense:

  1. â€œYou think youâ€™ve won? I am a dragon! Your victory is but a temporary illusion!â€

Before or After the Final Confruntation:

  1. â€œI have ruled the flames for ages, and I shall continue to do so, even if it means burning the world to cinders!â€
  2. â€œThe gods themselves fear my power. What chance do mere mortals have against me?â€
  3. â€œYou think yourselves heroes? How laughable. I will turn your valor to ashes and your ambitions to cinders.â€

Taunts and Mockery:

  1. "Is that all you've got? I've roasted meat more resilient than your pathetic attempts!"
  2. â€œYour defiance is amusing. Let me show you why dragons are to be feared!â€

When Defeated:

  1. â€œSo, you have bested me... for now.â€

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+10 to hit,, 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

Volcathar the Flameborn attacks with its Bite.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+10 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

Volcathar the Flameborn attacks with its Claw.

Fire Breath.name: Fire Breath
Fire Breath.description:
The dragon exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 (16d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Volcathar the Flameborn exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw.

Recharge Fire Breath.name: Recharge Fire Breath
Recharge Fire Breath.description: Automatically rolls to recharge Fire Breath at the start of each turn.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description: The Dragon can fly up to 80 ft.

Shortsword.name: çŸ­å‰‘
Shortsword.description: A medium sized blade with a firm crossguard and a leather-wrapped handle. A versatile weapon which makes up in versatility what it lacks in reach.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Shortsword (Main-Hand).name: çŸ­å‰‘ï¼ˆä¸»æ‰‹ï¼‰
Shortsword (Main-Hand).description: A medium sized blade with a firm crossguard and a leather-wrapped handle. A versatile weapon which makes up in versatility what it lacks in reach.

Shortsword (Off-Hand).name: çŸ­å‰‘ï¼ˆå‰¯æ‰‹ï¼‰
Shortsword (Off-Hand).description: A medium sized blade with a firm crossguard and a leather-wrapped handle. A versatile weapon which makes up in versatility what it lacks in reach.

Unarmed Strike.name: Unarmed Strike
Unarmed Strike.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

The cultist attacks with its fist.

Unarmored Defense.name: Unarmored Defense
Unarmored Defense.description:
The masked cultist AC is automatically calculated using the "Unarmored Defense (Monk)" setting on the character sheet. If armor is added to the cultist leader, the GM will need to manually adjust the AC.

While the masked cultist is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

Martial Arts.name: Martial Arts
Martial Arts.description:
Martial Arts does not have any automation. All the benefits of the feature are hardcoded into the Unarmed Strike ability.

The masked cultist can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of its Unarmed Strikes. It can roll a d4 in place of the normal damage of its Unarmed Strike. When it uses the Attack action with an Unarmed Strike on its turn, it can make one Unarmed Strike as a bonus action.

Bracers of Ignition.name: Bracers of Ignition
Bracers of Ignition.description:
Wondrous item, uncommon (requires attunement)

"There's no flame like dragonfire."

"There's no heat like dragon's breath."

"Thereâ€™s no burn like dragonâ€™s fury."

These bracers are crafted from the red scales of a young red dragon. The scales retain their innate heat, yet they are comfortable to wear.

Fiery Strikes. While wearing these bracers, your unarmed strikes and melee weapon attacks deal an additional [[/roll 1d4]] fire damage.

Fiery Strikes.name: Fiery Strikes
Fiery Strikes.description: Your unarmed strikes and melee weapon attacks deal an additional 1d4 fire damage.

The Flame Tyrant CR8.name: The Flame Tyrant CR8
The Flame Tyrant CR8.description:
The Flame Tyrant Quotes

  1. "I am the Flame Tyrant, and my rule shall scorch the world's pages with tales of my glory!"

  2. "Fire cleanses, purifies, and destroys. You think yourselves strong enough to command it? Let us test your resolve."

  3. "Extinguish my flames? Foolish mortals. My flames are eternal, as is my dominion over them. You will burn or bow."

  4. "Negotiate? There is but one negotiation: my will or your demise. What could you possibly offer that matches the power of fire?"

  5. "My flames are eternal, my power unyielding. Bow or burn."

  6. "The inferno that courses through me cannot be tamed by mortals. I am a living testament to fire's supremacy."

  7. "Ah, the ants dare to challenge the Flame Tyrant himself. Your defiance shall be a testament to the power of the inferno!"

  8. "Knowledge, you say? Power's true nature lies in wielding it, not in understanding it. But if you seek power, then face me and prove your worth."

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the Flame Tyrant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
The The Flame Tyrant can take 3 legendary actions. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The {creature} regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

The The Flame Tyrant can take 3 legendary actions.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description:
If a legendary creature has lair actions, it can use them to harness the ambient magic in its lair. On initiative count 20 (losing all initiative ties), it can use one of its lair action options. It can't do so while incapacitated or otherwise unable to take actions. If surprised, it can't use one until after its first turn in the combat.

If a legendary creature has lair actions, it can use them to harness the ambient magic in its lair.

Infernal Glide.name: Infernal Glide
Infernal Glide.description: Infernal Glide. The Flame Tyrant can move up to half its speed.

Fire Tornado.name: Fire Tornado
Fire Tornado.description: Fire Tornado. The Flame Tyrant creates a tornado of fire in a 10ft radius, 30ft high cylinder centered on a point he can see within range. The inferno whips up the terrain, melting or burning the ground and filling the air with ash and embers. For the next minute, the area within the cylinder becomes difficult terrain.

Fire Wall.name: Fire Wall
Fire Wall.description: Fire Wall. The Flame Tyrant creates a wall of fire in a 20ft long, 10ft high, and 5ft thick rectangle. When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d8 fire damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there.

Pyroblast Retaliation.name: Pyroblast Retaliation
Pyroblast Retaliation.description: Pyroblast Retaliation. The Flame Tyrant can cast Pyroblast at a creature he can see.

Ablazed.name: Ablazed
Ablazed.description: Ablaze from Pyroblast, you take an additional 1d4 fire damage at the start of each turn until you take an action to extinguish the flames.

Molten Resurgence.name: Molten Resurgence
Molten Resurgence.description: Molten Resurgence (1/Long Rest). As a bonus action, the Flame Tyrant can submerge himself into a pool of lava or magma and regain hit points equal to half of his max current hit point total.

Pyroblast.name: Pyroblast
Pyroblast.description: Pyroblast. As an action, The Flame Tyrant can target a creature within 120ft that it can see. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d8 fire damage. On a failed save, the target is also set ablaze, taking an additional 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns until it takes an action to extinguish the flames.

Ablazed.name: Ablazed
Ablazed.description: Ablaze from Pyroblast, you take an additional 1d4 fire damage at the start of each turn until you take an action to extinguish the flames.

Inferno Wave.name: Inferno Wave
Inferno Wave.description: Inferno Wave (Recharge 5-6). As an action, the Flame Tyrant slams the ground, causing waves of intense heat to ripple outward, igniting the ground with flames that persist for 1 minute. All creatures within a 15-foot radius, as well as any creature that enters the area for the duration, must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes vulnerable to fire damage for as long as it remains in the area. A creature that successfully saves is not affected by the vulnerability.

Infernal Explosion.name: Infernal Explosion
Infernal Explosion.description: Infernal Explosion (Recharge 5-6). The Flame Tyrant casts a fireball at a point he can see within range. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Pyro Head - The Infernal Crown.name: Pyro Head - The Infernal Crown
Pyro Head - The Infernal Crown.description:
Wondrous Item, legendary (requires attunement by a fighter, sorcerer, wizard, warlock or rogue)

"There is a fire inside. Watch the flames, the ancient, flickering of the relic's essence and become reborn."

The Infernal Crown, known also as the Pyro Head, is a relic forged in the heart of a extinguished volcano. The helm resembles a skull engulfed in flames.

Ember Gaze. As an action, you can unleash a gaze attack from the Pyro Head. Three rays shoot forth from the helm's eyes and mouth, targeting the nearest three creatures within a 30-foot cone. Each targeted creature must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 17). On a failed save, the creature takes 6d6 fire damage. On a successful save, they take half damage. If a creature dies from this attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to the damage the creature took.

This ability can be use twice per long rest.

Firewalk. You gain the ability to walk on the surface of lava or other molten substances as if they were solid ground. You leave no trail of fire behind and you are unharmed by the heat.

Inferno Barrier. You are immune to environmental heat damage and resistant to any fire-based attacks or spells.

Intimidating Aura. You gain a +5 bonus to Intimidation checks and a -5 penalty to Persuasion checks.

Curse. When the Infernal Crown is donned, the helm fuses with you, becoming unremovable. During this time, your head takes the appearance of a burning skull, wreathed in fire (the fire is harmless and does not emit heat and light). The helm cannot be removed as long as you live.

Pyro Head.name: Pyro Head
Pyro Head.description:
• Damage Resistance to fire.

  • +5 bonus to Intimidation checks.

  • -5 bonus to Persuasion checks.

Flame Shield.name: Flame Shield
Flame Shield.description:
Flame Shield. As a bonus action, The Flame Tyrant creates a shield of fire around himself. Until the spell ends, any creature within 5 feet that hits him with a melee attack takes 1d8 fire damage.

Death Nova.name: Death Nova
Death Nova.description: Death Nova. When the Flame Elemental dies, it explodes in a burst of fire. Each creature within 5 ft. of it must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 1d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flames Breath.name: Flames Breath
Flames Breath.description: Flames Breath. The Flame Elemental can breath flames to a creature within 5 ft. The creature must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful save.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+3 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

Death Burst.name: Death Burst
Death Burst.description: When the [[lookup @name uowercase]] is reduced to 0 hit points, it explodes in a burst of infectious decay. Each creature within 5ft must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 4 (1d6) poison damage.

Undead Fortitude.name: Undead Fortitude
Undead Fortitude.description:
If damage reduces the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] drops to 1 hit point instead.

If damage reduces the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw.

Ogre Chieftain Grom CR2.name: Ogre Chieftain Grom CR2
Ogre Chieftain Grom CR2.description:
Grom Quotes

  1. "Grom smash good! Anyone who say different gets clubbed!"

  2. "You think you can outsmart Grom? Ha! Me smarter than rock and twice as strong!"

  3. "Grom got big club, big fist, and big appetite. You taste good for dinner?"

  4. "Grom not need fancy spells. Glurg use big club and big teeth!"

  5. "You no come here and leave without broken bones!"

  6. "Grom no like visitors. Visitors get smashed, squashed, and eaten!"

  7. "Grak, get ready to smash. Time to show these little ones whoâ€™s boss!"

Hide Armor.name: å…½çš®ç”²
Hide Armor.description: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

Ogre Brutality.name: Ogre Brutality
Ogre Brutality.description: Ogre Brutality. A melee attack deals one extra die of its damage when the ogre hits with it.

Punch.name: Punch
Punch.description: Punch. Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On a hit, the target takes [[/roll 1d4 + 4]] bludgeoning damage.

Throw Rock.name: Throw Rock
Throw Rock.description: Throw Rock. Ranged Attack: +6 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. On a hit, the target takes [[/roll 1d6 + 4]] bludgeoning damage.

Ogreâ€™s Headbutt.name: Ogreâ€™s Headbutt
Ogreâ€™s Headbutt.description:
Weapon (greatclub), rare (requires attunement)

"It was said that Yig Bonegnaw had an iron skull so when he lost his head, they put his skull on a trunk of ironwood and bound it in steel so his mighty forehead will crush the bones of his enemies even in death."

This weapon appears as the skull of an ogre atop a heavy wooden club bound in metal rings.

When you are attuned to this greatclub, you gain the following benefits:

  • +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

  • Extra 1d8 bludgeoning damage to any creature it hits.

Ogre's Slam. When you wield the Ogre's Headbutt and your size is Large, your attacks gain the ability to knock down opponents. If your attack hits and deals half or more damage to a creature that is Large in size or smaller, that creature is knocked prone.

Giant Abomination CR7.name: Giant Abomination CR7
Giant Abomination CR7.description:
Giant Abomination Quotes

  1. "The cold is endless... endless like my torment."
  2. "The cold... it calls to me... I must find it."
  3. "You do not understand... I was once mighty... but now I am bound!"
  4. "Do you hear it? The call of the frost... I must answer. You cannot stop it."
  5. "This was never my fate... I was a giant, a protector... now, I am nothing."

Icewalker.name: Icewalker
Icewalker.description: Icewalker. The abomination can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesnâ€™t cost it extra movement.

Frost Explosion.name: Frost Explosion
Frost Explosion.description: Frost Aura. At the start of each of the abomination's turns, each creature within 10ft of it takes 5 (1d10) cold damage.

Shiverstrike.name: Shiverstrike
Shiverstrike.description:
Shiverstrike. Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target.
Hit: 14 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) cold damage.

Frost Trail.name: Frost Trail
Frost Trail.description: Frost Trail (Recharge 4â€“6). The abomination channels its icy power to freeze the ground along a 30ft line that is 10ft wide originating from itself. The frost persists for 1 minute and counts as difficult terrain. Any creature standing in the area when the frost appears must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

Frozen Retaliation.name: Frozen Retaliation
Frozen Retaliation.description: Frozen Retaliation. When a creature within 10ft of the abomination hits it with a melee attack, the abomination can release a burst of frost. The attacker must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 9 (2d8) cold damage and have its speed reduced by 10ft until the end of its next turn.

Frozen Retaliation.name: Frozen Retaliation
Frozen Retaliation.description: Movement speed reduced by 10ft until the end of next turn.

Frost Missile.name: Frost Missile
Frost Missile.description:
Frost Missile (Recharge 5â€“6). The abomination opens its mouth and fires a frost missile at a point it can see within 60ft. The missile explode in a burst of freezing air in a 15ft radius centered on that point.

Creatures in the radius must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The area becomes covered in slick frost for 1 minute, turning it into difficult terrain.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Obsidian Sentinel makes two melee attacks.

Obsidian Grip.name: Obsidian Grip
Obsidian Grip.description: Obsidian Grip. The Sentinel cannot be disarmed by any means, including spells or abilities that would force it to drop its weapon.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The Obsidian Sentinel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Obsidian Sentinel Scimitar.name: Obsidian Sentinel Scimitar
Obsidian Sentinel Scimitar.description:
Weapon (scimitar), rare (requires attunement)

"Within the obsidian's darkness, the sentinel's eye watches, and fear becomes our shield."

This scimitar is forged from obsidian and features a jagged, black blade.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

Dreadful Strike. On a critical hit, the target must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.oreoyaFKnvZCrgij]{Frightened} of you until the end of your next turn.

Obsidian Sentinel Set Bonus:

When both the Obsidian Sentinel Scimitar and the Obsidian Sentinel Shield are wielded and attuned to the same character, you gain the following abilities:

Sentinel's Mastery. Your critical hit threshold with the scimitar is increased to 19-20.

Dreadful Protector. As an action, you can channel the combined power of the scimitar and shield to create a wave of dread that emanates from you in a 15ft radius. Creatures within this area must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.oreoyaFKnvZCrgij]{Frightened} for 1 minute. They can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Obsidian Sentinel Shield.name: Obsidian Sentinel Shield
Obsidian Sentinel Shield.description:
Armor (shield), rare (requires attunement)

"Within the obsidian's darkness, the sentinel's eye watches, and fear becomes our shield."

This shield is made from obsidian and has an intimidating image of an eye on its surface.

While wielding this shield, you get +1 bonus to AC, in addition to the shield's normal bonus AC.

Sentinel's Ward. While wielding this shield, you can't be @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.oreoyaFKnvZCrgij].

Obsidian Sentinel Set Bonus:

When both the Obsidian Sentinel Scimitar and the Obsidian Sentinel Shield are wielded and attuned to the same character, you gain the following abilities:

Sentinel's Mastery. Your critical hit threshold with the scimitar is increased to 19-20.

Dreadful Protector. As an action, you can channel the combined power of the scimitar and shield to create a wave of dread that emanates from you in a 15ft radius. Creatures within this area must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.oreoyaFKnvZCrgij]{Frightened} for 1 minute. They can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: the [[lookup @name upercase]] has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to sleep.

Innate Spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
Innate Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name uperrcase]]'s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: dancing lights

1/day each: darkness, faerie fire

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name upercase]] has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

Shortsword.name: çŸ­å‰‘
Shortsword.description: A medium sized blade with a firm crossguard and a leather-wrapped handle. A versatile weapon which makes up in versatility what it lacks in reach.

Chain Shirt.name: é“¾ç”²è¡«
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vaguely humanoid form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light winks out if it exceeds the spell's range.

materials.value: A bit of phosphorus or wychwood, or a glowworm

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

materials.value: Bat fur and a drop of pitch or piece of coal

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Each object in a 20-foot cube within range is outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Any creature in the area when the spell is cast is also outlined in light if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed dim light in a 10-foot radius.

Any attack roll against an affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object can't benefit from being invisible.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Multiattack. The [[lookup @name upercase]] makes two attacks, either with its shortsword or its hand crossbow.

Hand Crossbow.name: Hand Crossbow
Hand Crossbow.description:
A lightweight crossbow designed to be held in one hand or strapped to one's wrist to fire light bolts.

On a hit, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Unconscious.name: Unconscious
Unconscious.description: Unconscious condition from hand crossbow due to failed Constitution by 5 or more.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two Rotting Claw attacks and one Corrupting Bite attack.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Shadow Drift.name: Shadow Drift
Shadow Drift.description: As a bonus action the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn.

Misty Escape.name: Misty Escape
Misty Escape.description:
When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling unconscious, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed.

While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its [[lookup @name lowercase]] form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its [[lookup @name lowercase]] form. It is then paralyzed until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

A slain [[lookup @name lowercase]] transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling unconscious.

Vampire Weaknesses.name: Vampire Weaknesses
Vampire Weaknesses.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the following flaws:

Forbiddance. the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

Harmed by Running Water. the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

Stake to the Heart. If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s heart while the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is incapacitated in its resting place, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is paralyzed until the stake is removed.

Sunlight Hypersensitivity. the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Sunlight Hypersensitivity.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
Sunlight Hypersensitivity.description:
While in sunlight, the vampire has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Remove this effect when the vampire is no longer in sunlight.

Putrid Spray.name: Putrid Spray
Putrid Spray.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] spews infectious rot in a 20ft cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (6d6) poison damage and becoming poisoned for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and not poisoned on a successful one. Poisoned targets repeat the save at the end of each turn, ending the condition on a success.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] spews infectious rot in a 20ft cone.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: Poisoned condition from the vampire Putrid Spray.

Infectious Bite.name: Infectious Bite
Infectious Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature grappled, prone, or incapacitated.
Hit: 8 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. The targetâ€™s hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target completes a long rest. A humanoid killed by this attack rises after 1 minute as a zombie under the vampireâ€™s control.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] attacks with its Bite.

Rotting Claw.name: Rotting Claw
Rotting Claw.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.
Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 4 (1d6) poison damage. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned until the end of its next turn.

Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 17).

On a successful hit, the vampire can choose to grapple the target instead of dealing damage. On its turn, the target can use its action to attempt to escape by making a [[/check ath acr 17]].

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: Poisoned condition from the vampre rotting claw attack.

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description: Grappled condition from the vampire rotting claw attack.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

Detect.name: Detect
Detect.description:
The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

The dragon watches its surrounding...

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the Red Dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to suceed instead.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
The dragon can fly up to 80 ft. using its wings. If the dragon is currently standing, activating this feature will cause it to fly. If the dragon is airborne, activating this feature will cause it to land.

The Dragon can fly up to 80 ft.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+14 to hit, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) slashing damage.

The Adult Dragon attacks with its Claw.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+14 to hit, 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

The Adult Dragon attacks with its Bite.

Tail.name: Tail
Tail.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+14 to hit,, 15 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

The Adult Red Dragon attacks with its Tail.

Frightful Presence.name: Frightful Presence
Frightful Presence.description:
Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute.

A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours .

Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

Fire Breath.name: Fire Breath
Fire Breath.description:
The dragon exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 63 (18d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The Dragon exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw.

Wing Attack.name: Wing Attack
Wing Attack.description:
The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw or take 15 (2d6+8) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

The dragon beats its wings!

Tail Attack.name: Tail Attack
Tail Attack.description:
The dragon makes a tail attack.

The dragon slams its long tail against its foe!

Giant Abomination CR4.name: Giant Abomination CR4
Giant Abomination CR4.description:
Giant Abomination Quotes

  1. "The cold is endless... endless like my torment."
  2. "The cold... it calls to me... I must find it."
  3. "You do not understand... I was once mighty... but now I am bound!"
  4. "Do you hear it? The call of the frost... I must answer. You cannot stop it."
  5. "This was never my fate... I was a giant, a protector... now, I am nothing."

Shiverstrike.name: Shiverstrike
Shiverstrike.description:
Shiverstrike. Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target.
Hit: 7 (1d6+ 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: the [[lookup @name upercase]] has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to sleep.

The [[lookup @name upercase]]'s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

Web Walker.name: Web Walker
Web Walker.description: the [[lookup @name upercase]] ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage.

the [[lookup @name upercase]] attacks with its Bite.

Longbow.name: Longbow
Longbow.description: A thick shaft of laminated wood is bowed by a taut string capable of launching deadly arrows at long distances.

Longsword.name: Longsword
Longsword.description: A lengthy straight blade designed for slashing foes, the longsword is a highly versatile weapon that may also be wielded with two hands for more punishing strikes.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vaguely humanoid form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

Faerie Fire.description:

Any attack roll against an affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object can't benefit from being invisible.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Multiattack. The [[lookup @name upercase]] makes three attacks, either with its longsword or its longbow. It can replace one of those attacks with a bite attack.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+3 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

Death Burst.name: Death Burst
Death Burst.description: When the [[lookup @name uowercase]] is reduced to 0 hit points, it explodes in a burst of infectious decay. Each creature within 5ft must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 4 (1d6) poison damage.

Undead Fortitude.name: Undead Fortitude
Undead Fortitude.description:
If damage reduces the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] drops to 1 hit point instead.

If damage reduces the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw.

Soulbound Knight CR4.name: Soulbound Knight CR4
Soulbound Knight CR4.description:
The Soulbound Knight Quotes

Before the Battle:

  1. "You trespass upon sacred ground. None shall leave unscathed."
  2. "My soul is bound to this wretched place. You will join me in eternal suffering."
  3. "The lich's will commands me, and I must obey. Prepare to face oblivion."

During the Battle:

  1. "Your fate is sealed, as was mine."
  2. "You cannot escape the ethereal grasp!"
  3. "Witness the power of the Harvester!"
  4. "You will find no sanctuary here."
  5. "Your struggle is futile; my minions hunger for your soul."

When Using Phantom Strike:

  1. "Behold, the realm between life and death!"
  2. "Feel the touch of the ethereal!"
  3. "You will know the despair of the in-between."

When Healing from Soul Rejuvenation:

  1. "Your efforts are in vain; I am restored!"
  2. "The more you fight, the stronger I become!"
  3. "Their sacrifice grants me strength!"

When Using Spirit Call:

  1. "Beware the haunting of the lost!"
  2. "Their torment shall be your end!"
  3. "Face the wrath of the forsaken souls!"
  4. "The souls of the forgotten shall be your doom."
  5. "Embrace the despair of those who came before."

When Severely Wounded:

  1. "The darkness... it tightens its grip."
  2. "My end is near, but so is yours!"

When Defeated:

  1. "Finally... release from this torment..."
  2. "The curse... is lifted... at last."
  3. "In death... I find peace..."

Plate Armor.name: æ¿ç”²
Plate Armor.description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Soulbound Knight makes two melee attacks with his glaive, The Harvester.

Ethereal Sight.name: Ethereal Sight
Ethereal Sight.description: The Soulbound Knight can see 60 ft. into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The Soulbound Knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Soulbound Fortitude.name: Soulbound Fortitude
Soulbound Fortitude.description:
If damage reduces the Soulbound Knight to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the Soulbound Knight drops to 1 hit point instead.

If damage reduces the Soulbound Knight to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw.

Soul Sacrifice.name: Soul Sacrifice
Soul Sacrifice.description: Soul Sacrifice. As a bonus action, the Soulbound Knight can destroy one of his Soul Servants to activate Soul Rejuvenation.

Spirit Call.name: Spirit Call
Spirit Call.description: Spirit Call. As a bonus action, the Soulbound Knight can command two souls from the swirling pool to attack his enemies.

Empowered Phantom Strike.name: Empowered Phantom Strike
Empowered Phantom Strike.description: Empowered Phantom Strike. The Soulbound Knight can use Phantom Strike again if no target is affected by etherealness.

Empowered Soul Reap.name: Empowered Soul Reap
Empowered Soul Reap.description: Empowered Soul Reap. This ability recharges on a roll of 5-6 on a d6.

The Harvester.name: The Harvester v1 (Copy)
The Harvester.description:
Weapon (glaive), rare (requires attunement)

"Each strike is like a dreadful whisper about the end of all life."

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

The Harvester is a glaive with a skull atop its shaft from which the blade emerges.

Dark Harvest. When striking a creature, the blade deals an additional [[/roll 1d4]] necrotic damage. If the creature dies, your next attack has advantage.

Phantom Strike. As an action, you can use Phantom Strike. When you hit a creature with this ability, it must make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the target enters an ethereal state for 1d4 rounds, existing simultaneously on both the Ethereal and Material Planes but having minimal interaction with either. The target can see both planes and see invisible creatures within a 60ft radius. Its attacks have disadvantage, it cannot pass through walls, and it is susceptible to damage from attacks in both planes. At the end of this duration, the target reappears in the Material Plane. You can use this ability once per long rest.

Soul Reap. Once per long rest, as an action, you can spin The Harvester releasing a burst of necrotic energy that targets all creatures within 10ft. Each creature in this area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/roll 1d10]] slashing damage plus [[/roll 1d8]] necrotic damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

Human Fighter CR1.name: Human Fighter CR1
Human Fighter CR1.description:
Sir Emil Corvian Quotes

On Duty & Honor:

  1. "A knightâ€™s duty is not to seek glory, but to stand between the innocent and harm."

On Becoming a Paladin:

  1. "I donâ€™t need to be the smartest, just the one willing to stand when others fall."
  2. "If the gods will not choose me, then I will prove myself until they do."

Words of Wisdom:

  1. "Thinking too hard gets you stuck. Do whatâ€™s right, and the rest follows."
  2. "I donâ€™t know all the answers, but I know right from wrong. Thatâ€™s enough."
  3. "You donâ€™t need to be clever to see when someoneâ€™s in trouble. You just need to care."

Chain Mail.name: é“¾ç”²
Chain Mail.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

Longsword.name: Longsword
Longsword.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Unarmored Defense.name: Unarmored Defense
Unarmored Defense.description:
The cultist leader's AC is automatically calculated using the "Unarmored Defense (Monk)" setting on the character sheet. If armor is added to the cultist leader, the GM will need to manually adjust the AC.

While the cultist leader is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

Martial Arts.name: Martial Arts
Martial Arts.description:
Martial Arts does not have any automation. All the benefits of the feature are hardcoded into the Unarmed Strike ability.

The cultist leader can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of its Unarmed Strikes. It can roll a d6 in place of the normal damage of its unarmed attack. When it uses the Attack action with an Unarmed Strike on its turn, it can make one Unarmed Strike as a bonus action.

Unarmed Strike.name: Unarmed Strike
Unarmed Strike.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

The cultist attacks with its fist.

Draconic Command.name: Draconic Command
Draconic Command.description: As an action, once per short rest, the cultist leader channels the power of its draconic patron to inspire and empower its allies. For the next 1 minute, up to 5 allies of the cultist leader within 30ft who can hear it gain Multiattack.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Multiattack. The cultist makes three Unarmed Strikes.

Stillness of Mind.name: Stillness of Mind
Stillness of Mind.description: The cultist leader can use its action to end one effect on itself that is causing it to be charmed or frightened.

Bracers of Ignition.name: Bracers of Ignition
Bracers of Ignition.description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

"There's no flame like dragonfire."

"There's no heat like dragon's breath."

"Thereâ€™s no burn like dragonâ€™s fury."

These bracers are crafted from the red scales of a young red dragon. The scales retain their innate heat, yet they are comfortable to wear.

Fiery Strikes. While wearing these bracers, your unarmed strikes and melee weapon attacks deal an additional [[/roll 1d4]] fire damage.

Scorching Eruption. Once per long rest, as an action, you can slam the bracers together to release a wave of fiery energy. All creatures within a 10ft radius must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking [[/roll 4d6]] fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

Fiery Strikes.name: Fiery Strikes
Fiery Strikes.description: Your unarmed strikes and melee weapon attacks deal an additional 1d4 fire damage.

Vitality Beam.name: Vitality Beam
Vitality Beam.description: Vitality Beam. As an action, the Shard of Vitality emits a beam that connects it to a creature. While the Shard remains active, the creature gains 150 temporary hit points.

Shortbow.name: çŸ­å¼“
Shortbow.description: This two handed bow is somewhat smaller than the traditional longbow variant, making it well suited for rapid attacks while on the move or mounted from horseback.

Quiver.name: Quiver
Quiver.description: A quiver can hold up to 20 arrows.

Arrow.name: Arrow
Arrow.description: Standard ammunition used for bows of all varieties. These mundane arrows are made of smooth wooden shafts with goose feather fletching and hammer metal bodkins.

Shortsword.name: çŸ­å‰‘
Shortsword.description: A medium sized blade with a firm crossguard and a leather-wrapped handle. A versatile weapon which makes up in versatility what it lacks in reach.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two Slam attacks and uses Unsettling Visage if available.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: [[/attack]] (with Advantage during the first round of each combat), reach 5 ft. [[/damage average extended]].

attack.condition: with Advantage during the first round of each combat

Unsettling Visage.name: Unsettling Visage
Unsettling Visage.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 12, each creature in a 15-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] that can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Read Thoughts.name: Read Thoughts
Read Thoughts.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts Detect Thoughts, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @abilities.cha.dc]]).
